item.description:
Welcome to the Providence Collective FYI Series!

As I hear of things that might be interesting to Collective members, I will post them. I can't make all events, but if you are interested in hosting, please say so in your RSVP - its easy and fun - really!

Designing for Urban Agriculture: What is the place of food in the city?

How are "waste" spaces being transformed by food projects?

What are the implications on materials, technologies and structures?

Carrot City is a traveling exhibit that shows how the design of buildings and cities can enable the production of food in the city. (For example - our very own Gracie's Restaurant has a rooftop garden on the Peerless Building.) It explores the relationships between design and urban food systems as well as the impact that agricultural issues have on the design of urban spaces and buildings. The exhibit explores these issues at four different scales, the city scale, the community scale,home and work and the products that make all of this possible Carrot City will be exhibited at the AIA/RI Gallery in Providence, Rhode Island Date of Exhibition: Friday, February 25, 2011 - Friday, March 11, 2011

Location: AIA/RI gallery, 158 Washington Street, Providence, RI

Grand Opening: Friday, February 25, beginning at 5pm.

More on Carrot City: http://www.ryerson.ca/carrotcity/
item.how_to_find_us: Posted as an FYI - if you are interested in hosting, please say so in your RSVP!
item.why: Carrot City is an interesting and inspiring exhibit! Been to the Farmer's Market lately? Winter blues getting you down? Spring is around the corner! This just might inspire you to get down and dirty and grow your own!
item.name: Providence Collective FYI Series - CARROT CITY: Designing for Urban Agriculture
